title: Project Engineer II - Process
description:
Overview:
**Are you ready to move your career forward, and start the BEST job of your life? Haskell is committed to providing you with the resources to help you grow and discover your potential. We promote an environment that encourages innovative ideas and allows you to develop the best “how” to get the job done.**  

Haskell’s Design & Consulting Team unites architecture, engineering, and consulting professionals from across industries and geographies. Our diverse and innovative team allows Haskell to serve our clients with multiple project delivery methods including design-build, engineer-procure-construct, fee-for-service, or consulting services. These services allow our team to form a strong rapport with clients, marshalling them as they grow and helping them address industry and market challenges. The Design & Consulting Team serves a diverse set of markets including food and beverage, consumer products, aviation and aerospace, civil infrastructure, healthcare, and Federal Government projects. As a team member at Haskell, you’ll have the opportunity to work on impactful projects that will challenge your creativity, innovation, and expand your skill set.  

In this role, you will capitalize on your skills while being responsible for the production of innovative designs, drawings, and specifications for your assigned process projects. Your high-quality work will contribute to Haskell’s continual ranking as an industry leader in the Food and Beverage and Manufacturing market sectors. You will have the opportunity to apply critical thinking and experience in our core markets, including Food and Beverage, to deliver integrated processes/systems while also delivering a World Class Client Experience. This opportunity will allow for a variety of work and collaboration including, but not limited to process system design; construction support; project management; professional development; leadership; planning, scheduling, and profitability. **Job Responsibilities:*** Application of Knowledge of Process Systems
	+ Researches, documents, and is responsible for discipline design compliance with all applicable codes, ordinances, standards and regulations.
	+ Responsible for placement of safety symbols on construction documents as necessary for discipline
	+ Applies discipline design methods and detailing fundamentals in developing designs and specifications.
	+ Performs analysis or calculations as assigned for process throughput and mass balance and selects proper equipment for the applications.
* Design
	+ Ensures well-organized, finished design documents of good appearance, accuracy, clarity, and correctness from layouts, sketches, or their written instructions.
	+ Actively participates in project strategy meetings, develops design concept, and recommends equipment and systems within discipline.
	+ Researches and is responsible for discipline design compliance with proposal/client criteria.
	+ Assures adherence to drawing production strategy. Writes discipline specifications for assigned projects.
	+ Responsible for the development of PFDs (process flow diagrams) and P&IDs for all assigned projects, making recommendations and coordinating changes/updates as necessary.
	+ Develops and verifies equipment lists, equipment specifications, and controls, as well as instrumentation requirements for each assigned process project.
* Construction Support
	+ Checks shop drawings and submittal data for conformance with contract documents
	+ Participates in plant surveys or field inspections, development of solutions to field problems, preparation of field orders, addenda and record drawings.
	+ Advises and assists construction personnel in the interpretation and clarification of construction documents.
	+ Performs, as requested, construction inspections, at the client’s site or at a vendor for specialty equipment, to monitor compliance with design intent, construction drawings, and specifications. Prepares inspection reports.
	+ Provides timely solutions to field problems and prepares field orders, addenda and record drawings.
	+ Supports and performs start-up activities.
* Project Management
	+ Performs dimensional, interference, and basic design checks on layouts and sketches and, as requested, on interdisciplinary drawing sets.
	+ Coordinates work with other disciplines. Performs interdisciplinary coordination checks to minimize deficiencies, errors and omissions in drawings and specifications.
	+ Coordinates the development of PFDs (process flow diagrams) and P&IDs for all assigned projects.
* Planning, Scheduling, and Profitability
	+ Participates in assigned client meetings and prepares and reviews presentation material.
	+ Creates work plan for assigned tasks.
	+ Creates orderly work files and prepares clear, well-written memos/correspondence.
	+ Assists the project team with the identification of process partners (equipment & automation) and pre-qualifies them for appropriate services.
	+ Produces pricing and proposal presentation documents and outline specifications.
	+ Monitors and projects personal workload status, advising supervisor of difficulties in accomplishing schedules and determines any schedule changes.
* Professional Development
	+ Participates in professional community organizations and trade organizations within discipline.
* Leadership
	+ Adheres to established company standards and policies.
	+ Directs technical efforts of discipline subordinates assigned to the project.

**Education/Experience:*** Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Chemical and Biological Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering is preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years of process design and application engineering experience
* Experience in designing factories or industrial plants.
* Experience designing process systems for food and beverage. (Preferred)
* Experience in refrigeration and utility design is a plus.
* Strong experience and knowledge of a variety of food processing equipment/systems, sanitary design, and hygienic requirements including mixing, baking, frying, and a working knowledge of controls and instrumentation commonly used.
* Strong preference for remote candidates to be based out of the Kentucky area.

**Specific Knowledge, Skills, License, Certifications:*** Working knowledge of related regulatory, oversight, and advisory agencies: AIB, FDA, USDA, EPA, GMPs, and HACCP

**Haskell offers a very robust and comprehensive benefits package! Some of our offerings are:**

  

* Health, dental, and vision insurance plans
* Company provided hospital indemnity, accident and critical care plans.
* Retirement savings plan (401k) with company discretionary matching contributions
* Employee Stock Ownership Plan
* Paid time off and nine company holidays
* Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career
* Flexible work hours and remote work options
* Employee assistance programs for physical and mental well-being
* Opportunities for growth and advancement within the organization
* AND many more!

**Environmental Factors and/or Physical Requirements:**  

While performing the duties of this job, this position is required to have ordinary ambulatory skills sufficient to visit other locations; and the ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, and manipulate (lift, carry, move) light to medium weights of 10-50 pounds. Requires good hand-eye coordination, and arm, hand and finger dexterity, including the ability to grasp, and visual acuity to use a keyboard, operate equipment and read application/form information. The associate frequently is required to sit, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear. **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities:**  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or protected veteran status.  

Haskell will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 and the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act of 2008. The job description will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessities. Essential and marginal job functions are subject to modification.  

Haskell is a Drug-Free Workplace. **Salary Range:**  

The base salary for this position is $85,000 - $145,000. The actual salary will be determined based on the candidate's knowledge, skills, experience, and location. **#LI-LM1****#LI-remote**

title: Project Controls Engineer - Plainsboro, NJ
description:
DSM North America, Inc. seeks a Project Controls Engineer for its Plainsboro Township, NJ location.
  
  

**Duties:** Early phase project cost estimating (Front-End Loading (FEL) 1-3 / Feasibility, Conceptual, and Basic phases) for R&D, Chemical & Industrial Plants (Biotech – Fermentation), Animal & Human Nutrition facilities compliant with Current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP). Project Controls Plans for CAPEX projects of various sizes and complexities. Cost and Schedule Forecast at Completion (Estimate at Completion) using Cost Performance Index (CPI) and Schedule Performance Index (SPI). Support for Global Cost Estimating database metrics and data gathering for project KPIs, benchmarking, and cost appraisals. Basis of Estimate (BOE) documentation throughout the estimate lifecycle, noting the scope, execution strategy, level of precision, key assumptions, exclusions, risks, and other critical project information. Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) for Brownfield and Greenfield facility projects. Estimating total installed factors for ISBL (inside battery limits) and OSBL (outside battery limits) project scope. Estimates for owner costs / internal resource allocations. Validation of consolidated estimates using benchmarked industry data. Project Risk Assessments (PRA), including a risk register, quantitative and qualitative risk identification, assessments, and analysis (Monte-Carlo modeling @Risk & Crystal Ball platforms), opportunity management, and applying project risk management principles, practices, standards, and methods. Progress cost and schedule performance validation. Project escalation & inflation estimating models based on market conditions and execution timelines. Integration of level 1-3 project schedules, milestones, and activity durations from multiple contractors. Time impact analysis, critical path analysis, resource leveling, and related qualitative and quantitative schedule evaluations. Project Controls requirements (Earned Value, Rules of Credit, Reporting, Critical Path) for Engineering and Construction Contracts (AIA G702 and G703 forms). Performance indicators (KPIs), data, and trends using reports, charts, tables, dashboards. Market Intelligence (CMI) investigation and reporting for structural steel, labor rates, price per sqft, lead-times. Project and program reporting standards using Power BI, PIMS 365, PowerPoint, etc. and other Continuous Improvement (CI) initiatives for DSM HQ, Stage Gate, and VAR (Value Assurance Reviews) / Value Engineering. Stage Gate Reviews (SGR) of project cost estimates for DSM capital projects worldwide.
  
  

Requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent, in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Engineering (any) or related field and six (6) years of progressively responsible, post-baccalaureate experience as Project Controls Engineer, Project Cost Engineer, or a related position for a life sciences, engineering or oil and gas company. At least six (6) years of employment experience must include: Servicing multi-million dollar capital projects from feasibility phase through detailed engineering and design phase to commissioning phase; Overseeing project management and capital projects delivery processes, including Total Cost Management (TCM), Earned Value Management (EVM); and Developing the overall estimate schedule identifying all deliverable, including estimating scope of work, preparation of the estimate methodology and basis of the estimate. At least three (3) years of experience must include using SAP, Ecosys, PIMS, and Procore to manage capital projects, cost control, planning and scheduling, change and trends control, cost validation, progress measurement, and reporting. Telecommuting permitted from anywhere in the US. Requires 25% travel domestic and international. 40 hours/week. Direct applicants only.
  
  

Qualified applicants may visit our website at https://www.dsm-firmenich.com/corporate/careers.html and apply online (Job ID 67797). EOE M/F/D/V.
  
  

#ext

title: Sr. Packaging Engineer
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.


Sr. Packaging Engineer

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role you will report into the Packaging Engineering group under Combination Product Operations (CPO) and is located in Thousand Oaks, CA. The position will support global supply, new product introductions, partnerships/acquisitions and combination products. This position will apply engineering principles to implement the accurate design, qualification and implementation of Primary and Secondary Packaging components and the associated systems such as documentation, equipment, and processes. A knowledge of common materials used in healthcare packaging is key to this role. Material knowledge of structural components are integral in the day-to-day oversight of this role: bottles, labels, trays, lidding material, leaflets, paperboard, sterile barrier packaging, corrugate, etc. This role may have some junior level management potential and the successful candidate will also apply excellent organizational, project management, technical problem solving and communication (written and verbal) skills, with the ability to work in teams and adapt to a dynamic environment.

* Possible management of junior level engineers and contingent workers
* Lead testing and evaluations to recommend and select primary and secondary packaging materials for both large and small molecule products
* Perform distribution testing per ASTM D4169. Complete testing standards using ASTM, ISO, TAPPI, USP and EP
* Writing of test protocols, perform technical evaluations and testing to support reports used to uphold the use of selected materials and packaging components
* Crafting specifications along with implementation through technical change records
* Build, modify, and approve engineering drawings using AutoCAD, Adobe Illustrator, Solid Works, or similar software applications
* Assist in trouble shooting and leading investigations on Packaging Component problems for areas in production, warehouse, incoming inspection (minor and major deviation lead)
* Support line trials and packaging validation activities prior to introduction of any new or change in components/processes
* Collaborate with multi-functional teams (i.e. Manufacturing, Process Development, Quality, Supply Chain, Maintenance, Device Engineering, Primary Container Engineering, Artwork/Labeling, Regulatory, etc.) in pre-commercial and commercial activities
* Represent CPO and Manufacturing Sciences and Technology (MSAT) as Final Product Technical Lead
* Support Pre-Approval Inspections, Audits, and interact with regulatory bodies (e.g., FDA, EMEA, etc) as needed

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our outstanding contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an individual with these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Doctorate degree in Packaging, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related engineering field


OR


Master’s degree in Packaging, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related engineering field & 2years of Packaging Engineering experience


OR


Bachelor’s degree in Packaging, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related engineering field & 4 years of Packaging Engineering experience


OR


Associate’s degree in Packaging, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related engineering field & 8 years of Packaging Engineering experience


OR


High school diploma / GED & 10 years of Packaging Engineering experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Packaging, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related engineering field
* 7+ years of packaging engineering experience with 4+ years within the Pharma/Bio industry

**Demonstrated Competencies/Skills:**
-------------------------------------

* Familiar with distribution testing per ASTM D4169. Familiarity with ASTM, ISO, TAPPI, USP and EP testing standards.
* Knowledge of primary and secondary packaging systems and material science is critical to the position
* Strong organizational, project management, technical problem solving and communication (written and verbal) skills, and the ability to work in teams and adapt to continuously evolving environment
* Excellent understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Documentation Practices (GDP)
* Independent problem solver with demonstrated skills working in teams or leading project teams

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Remediation Engineer
description:
**Engineer – Environmental Remediation**


Weaver Consultants Group has openings for Environmental Remediation Engineers or Scientists at both the Project and Staff level to become an integral member of our team and support the design, implementation and monitoring of environmental remediation projects across the country.


We are looking for a candidate with a minimum of 1 year of experience working for an environmental consulting firm or other applicable environmental sector. They will be a self-motivated, career-oriented engineer/scientist with a good understanding of chemistry/geology, have experience in environmental site assessments, groundwater monitoring and reporting, remediation technologies, and have remediation project design, field implementation and oversight experience. The candidate will be mentored to become an industry-leading environmental remediation professional.


The position has significant growth potential as the selected candidate will work directly with and be mentored by nationally recognized environmental remediation engineers and geologists supporting in-situ chlorinated hydrocarbon remediation projects for large Brownfield redevelopment and industrial manufacturing companies in Connecticut, Colorado, Nebraska, Kansas, Texas, New Jersey, and California.

**Responsibilities**

* Conduct groundwater, surface water, and soil sampling.
* Perform lithologic and geophysical logging of geotechnical boreholes.
* Oversee monitor well, gas probe, and other compliance monitoring and remediation system installations.
* Conduct statistical analysis on groundwater monitoring data.
* Assist in the development and implementation of geologic and hydrogeologic investigations and evaluations.
* Implement and manage site assessments (Geoprobe, HSA drilling, geological logging).
* Interact with clients and participate in regulatory meetings in a support role.
* Organize and manage field sampling efforts, manage large amounts of laboratory data, analyze information, and prepare semi-annual reports.
* Apply technical and critical thinking skills to meet project demands and solve problems for our clients.
* Design and implement site characterization activities.
* Remediation design and implementation (installation, operation, maintenance and monitoring) of some or all of the following remedial technologies: soil vapor extraction (SVE), in-situ chemical oxidation (ISCO), enhanced reductive dechlorination (ERD), Carbon Trap and Treat BOS-100/200.
* Communicate effectively with colleagues and superiors.
* Support senior staff as needed to complete tasks. This often includes work in excess of 40 hours per week.

**Requirements**

* BS or MS in Engineering, Chemistry, Geology, or related field with at least 1 year of professional experience in discipline
* Detail oriented and timely in completing assignments and contribute to a positive work environment
* Ability to balance personal and project workloads and schedules for multiple projects
* Works well as an independent but accountable team member
* Excellent oral and written communication skills, with proficiency in MS Office
* Working understanding of ArcGIS, Google Earth, and/or AutoCAD preferred
* EIT, PE, or RG/PG certification or have the necessary experience to obtain certification


The position is a salaried position with significant bonus opportunity and the work hours are flexible targeting 45 hours per week, working approximately 40-50% in the field. Typical salary range for this position is $65,000 to $90,000 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. The position will require out-of-town travel at an average rate of one week a month. The successful candidate must demonstrate efficiency and competency working well in an independent / telecommuting environment.


EOE/AA/M/F/Vet/Disability


Weaver Consultants Group maintains a drugfree workplace.

title: Chemical Engineer (Water Treatment)
description:
**Summary:**


At Aquatech, we tackle the challenges of water scarcity and complexity by leveraging technology, expertise, and financing to deliver comprehensive solutions that reduce carbon and recycled water footprint. As a leading global provider of water and process technology solutions, we help the world's most recognized companies achieve their sustainability and operational goals by implementing innovative approaches for water reuse, desalination, minimal and zero liquid discharge, and critical minerals recovery. Our work catalyzes the transition toward a more sustainable future and showcases our commitment to addressing water's role in climate adaptation. Learn more atwww.aquatech.com


Currently, Aquatech has an immediate need for a full-time Chemical Engineer to work remotely. The hours are Monday - Friday 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. The Chemical Engineer will perform the duties described in the job description below and will be considered an Exempt employee.


The ideal candidate will review and prepare Request For Proposals (RFPs) for water treatment and wastewater recycling treatment systems.

 **Minimum Qualifications / Experience:**

* Bachelor's in Mechanical, Chemical, or Environmental Engineering or related engineering degree or equivalent.
* Five (5) or more years of relevant experience

 **Job Description:**

* Provide oversight on water treatment strategies for semiconductor manufacturing, ensuring optimal performance, quality, and compliance of various water systems, such as ultra-pure water (UPW), and other industrial wastewater.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement opportunities for development and innovation, leveraging expertise in water purification and industrial water treatment.
* Review and prepare RFPs for water treatment and wastewater recycle treatment systems. Including:
* Prepare appropriate responses to RFPs, including developing process flow diagrams, piping and instrumentation diagrams, and GA drawings.
* Guide draftsperson in preparing technical drawings.
* Perform process calculations to properly size treatment processes and equipment.
* Conduct comprehensive project mass balance to identify and implement value engineering and optimization opportunities
* Compose technical clarifications and deviations to the RFP.
* Solicit and develop inquiries for sub-vendor quotes for req’d components to assemble a complete system.
* Develop a cost estimate and budget for the proposed system.
* Compile sections of the proposal compromising specific technical data and descriptions, performance guarantees, warranty, and technical clarifications.
* Assist the sales manager in responding to customers’ technical queries.
* Prepare a TOP for each successful proposal.
* Develop and update process calculations spreadsheets and technical documentation required in proposal preparation.
* Provide Process support during system commissioning/start-up to the commissioning engineer and troubleshoot related issues.

 **Skill Requirements:**

* Must know through coursework or experience: water chemistry; water treatment equipment process design/sizing calculations; proposal/bid preparation; metallic and non-metallic construction materials utilized in water treatment processes; industry-standard software for membrane and ion exchange resin-based equipment design; and water treatment and wastewater recycle treatment system processes (including physical/chemical conditioning processes, clarification process, ultrafiltration (UF), ion-exchange processes, and reverse osmosis (RO)).
* Review and prepare RFPs for water treatment and wastewater recycle treatment systems using knowledge of water chemistry and water treatment process and equipment.
* Basic P&ID development and BIM modeling experience

 **Benefits:**


Aquatech offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off, company-paid holidays, and a 401K plan (all benefits are based on eligibility).

 **Essential Functions:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above and below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

 **Physical Job Demands:**

Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, limited walking and standing.

 **Minimum Qualifications / Experience:**

* Bachelor's in Mechanical, Chemical, or Environmental Engineering or related engineering degreeor equivalent.
* Five (5) or more years of relevant experience

title: Air Quality Professional
description:
**About The Role:**


This opportunity is for a flexible and self-motivated air quality professional. You will be responsible for managing project delivery as well as assisting clients with all aspects of air quality permitting and compliance requirements. If hired, you can expect up to 25% short-term and extended travel.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Prepare annual emissions reports such as state emissions inventories, greenhouse gas (GHG) reports, and Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) reports, as well as other period compliance reports (Title V deviation reporting, NESHAP compliance reporting, etc.)
* Complete state and federal air permit applications, including emission inventories, synthetic minor strategies, and other associated technical documents.
* Provide accurate technical calculations and effective written communication to contribute to project deliverables.
* Conduct regulatory research and provide meaningful interpretations for clients.
* Correspond with federal, state, and local regulatory agencies.
* Audit regulatory compliance and management systems at the plant and corporate level.
* Understand existing regulations and continually review new and proposed regulations as they relate to clients.
* Use technical expertise to guide facilities through federal, state, and local air quality permitting and compliance requirements.


**Qualifications:**

* B.S. or M.S. degree in Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Meteorology, Environmental Science, or related fields
* 5-10 years of direct experience in air quality permitting and compliance

**Additional experience in these areas is a plus:**


* Experience with PSD/NSR permitting and procedures
* Experience in multi-media permitting and compliance efforts in addition to air (RCRA, NPDES, SPCC)


**Skills required for success in this role include:**


* Working knowledge of state and federal air permitting and compliance requirements
* Experience in project management of air quality permitting and compliance projects
* Ability to understand, interpret, and implement complex air quality regulations
* Knowledge of air quality dispersion modeling programs and practices
* Time management, project management, and problem-solving skills
* Ability to build and maintain client relationships and effectively lead projects that consistently exceed client expectations
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* High attention to detail
* Proficient with use of Excel


**Traits required for success in our team:**


* Flexibility and ability to manage multiple deadlines and fast-changing priorities
* Display integrity through honesty, fairness, & respect
* Possesses a sense of responsibility and takes accountability
* Takes initiative
* Maintains a sense of ownership over delivery of projects
* Trustworthy & dependable
* Good listener & fosters teamwork

title: Process/Chemical Engineer - Remote
description:
**Why join us?**


It’s an exciting time at AtkinsRéalis! We are rapidly growing in the US. Our company purpose is to build a better world for our planet and its people. We recognize the importance of making sure that our clients and employees, feel this purpose every day. AtkinsRéalis is proud of our company culture that promotes, diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company ethos include collaboration through the connection of people, data and technology. We are a global firm, who leverages having employees located throughout the world, creating valuable partnerships and doing our part to make this planet and its people, thrive. We need energetic, passionate and eager professionals like you to join our team. There has never been a better time to be a part of AtkinsRéalis!


We are seeking a ***Process/Chemical Engineer – Remote.******This remote position is based out of our Richland, WA office.***

**About Us**


AtkinsRéalis is one of the world’s most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. AtkinsRéalis has been providing infrastructure planning, engineering, construction, environmental consulting, urban planning, architecture, and program management services to public and private clients across the United States for more than 50 years. AtkinsRéalis has the depth and breadth of expertise to respond to the most technically challenging and time-critical infrastructure projects and the urgent transition to a low-carbon economy.

**How will you contribute to the team?**

* Performs a variety of engineering calculations using traditional engineering methods to document compliance with project and code requirements, which may include mass and energy balances, pressure profiles, pipe, pump and vessel sizing.
* Experience in using software tools to model and optimize chemical and engineering processes.
* Assists in the preparation and approval of design documents, plant modifications and software QA documentation.
* Interfaces with technology and engineering staff and supporting sub-contractors to ensure work is being completed in a safe and efficient manner, ensuring that safety is an integral element embodied in equipment design and specification.
* Works in multi-discipline teams on project-based work and ensures integration of design across multiple disciplines.
* Performs checking to ensure accuracy of process simulation models and other design media in accordance with company policies and procedures and client expectations.
* Works to assigned schedules ensuring the accuracy, completeness and timeliness of work and initiates corrective measures to overcome delays.
* Recommends new equipment, concepts and techniques to improve performance, simplify design, reduce costs, correct design flaws or to comply with changes in client requirements, codes or regulations.
* Performs independent research, reviews, studies and analyses in support of plant changes and design modifications.
* Relies on limited experience and judgment.
* Works under limited supervision.
* Some creativity and latitude is expected.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**What will you contribute?**

* Requires Bachelor's degree required in Chemical Engineering.
* Minimum of 5 years' experience.
* Professional Engineering License preferred.
* Proficiency in process modeling software such as ASPEN/gPROMs/Aveva/CHEMCAD or similar.
* Intermediate knowledge of Process Equipment design software and Microsoft Office.
* Intermediate knowledge of functional discipline and its practical application.
* Proficiency in developing steady state and/or dynamic process simulation models.
* Fully conversant with Process Flow Diagrams, Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs) and Process Data Sheets.
* Strong communication skills.
* Must be a U.S citizen in order to be considered.


**What we offer at AtkinsRéalis:**


AtkinsRéalis realizes that health, mental and financial wellbeing, are all equally needed to achieve balance in life. We are pleased to offer a robust rewards package that help our employees have peace of mind in and outside of work. Our benefit offerings address all of the areas that are part of living a healthy life.


We recognize that what is important to people, continues to change. Some of our other benefits to ensure our employees feel supported, include continuing to offer health and dental coverage for domestic partners and a full list below. Our culture is one of providing support and training for our employees to thrive. We offer learning and development programs, training, career pathing opportunities, and a tuition reimbursement plan. At AtkinsRéalis, you will enjoy a robust rewards package which includes:

* Competitive salary
* Flexible work schedules
* Group Insurance
* Paid Family Leave
* Two Floating Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave (including maternity and paternity)
* Pet Insurance
* Retirement Savings Plan with employer match
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Learning and development programs, training, career opportunities and a highly regarded tuition reimbursement program
* An inclusive culture of Employee Resources Groups centered around women, African-Americans, Hispanics, LGBTQ+, Neurodiversity and Emerging Professionals.
* A Foundation that is employee-funded with a 2-to-1 match from the company providing STEAM education for minorities from K-12 to college

**If this sounds like you and you would like to expand your career with us, apply today!**

**AtkinsRéalis** **is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer** committed to diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Veteran/Disability.


Please review AtkinsRéalis Equal Opportunity Statement here:


https://careers.atkinsrealis.com/equal-opportunities-statement

**AtkinsRéalis** **cares about your privacy** and are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.


By submitting your personal information to AtkinsRéalis, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

**Expected** **compensation range** **is** **between** **$77,000 to $129,000 annually****.**

Upon acceptance of an offer, all candidates must go through a drug screen test and background check. AtkinsRéalis is a federal contractor which mandates a satisfactory background screening report and drug test that supersedes state laws.

**Note to staffing and direct hire agencies:**


In the event a recruiter or agency who is not on our preferred supplier list submits a resume/candidate to anyone in the company, AtkinsRéalis family of companies, we explicitly reserve the right to recruit and hire the candidate(s) at our discretion and without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. https://careers.atkinsrealis.com/recruitment-agencies

title: Operations Engineer
description:
Generate Upcycle is hiring an **Operations Engineer** for our Wastewater Treatment division! The position is a critical member of our team, and will have a direct impact on the day-to-day operations and overall successful growth of the business. As the Operations Engineer you will work with internal teams & 3rd party vendors to safely commission and integrate new projects into the wastewater operations portfolio. You'll be one of the primary representatives providing oversight to the project design, design iteration, construction and commissioning process, and you will continue to support and interact with projects after they are in commercial operation.

Duties & Responsibilities:

* Perform process engineering assessments of technology in both design and operating phase.
* Periodically provide process engineering expertise to support operating facility challenges
* Provide operations-focused input on project design through participation in periodic design phase reviews
* Perform detailed reviews and provide input to shape operational processes, such as standard operating procedures, process & task hazard analysis, and basic process control assessment
* Drive change management - monitor and provide oversight to design iteration through project design, construction and operating phases with focus on rigorous methodical change management practices
* Provide onsite operational oversight for commissioning and startup of new assets
* Identify improvement opportunities and work with internal and third party teams to development improvement projects for operating sites
* Use operational expertise to identify/quantify what "good" operational execution looks like and translate to site operating practices
* Periodically take on business actives outside of core engineering/operations discipline including marketing, sales, finance, etc.
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Education, Experience and Certifications:

* Bachelor's degree in chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, or related field of study
* Five (5) years' relevant experience
* Previous experience in wastewater treatment plant and/or biological process systems preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

* Must be able to travel within the US, to Canada and the UK
* Strong knowledge of process engineering principles and practical application in design & operations of continuous process manufacturing facilities
* Basic understanding of EHS programs & process safety principles and application to continuous process manufacturing facilities
* Analytical, planning, prioritization, execution and problem-solving skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment, with multiple departments and key business partners
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and multi-task to meet target deadlines, with attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to decipher technical data and explain in English
* Must possess a high level of moral judgement for handling confidential information
* Strong diplomatic, negotiation, and conflict-resolution skills

Physical Requirements:

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment

* Positions operates in several different environments which includes a professional office and field environment.
* Travel required, up to 30%.
* Position is remote

*Generate Upcycle is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or handicap, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly bonus

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Travel requirement:

* Up to 25% travel

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Chemical engineering: 5 years (Preferred)
* Mechanical engineering: 5 years (Preferred)
* Wastewater: 5 years (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Process Engineer
description:
Location: Candidates may be remote anywhere within the United States with 80% travel to customer sites.  

 ARE YOU READY TO BE A PIONEER IN THE WATER INDUSTRY?  

At 374Water, our mission is to preserve a clean and healthy environment that sustains life. Our revolutionary AirSCWO technology transforms the most complex wastes - to clean water, energy, and minerals. We are pioneering a new era of sustainable waste management that supports a circular economy and enables organizations to achieve their sustainability goals. 374Water is a public cleantech company, innovating in the water and waste industries.  

JOB SUMMARY
As a Process Engineer, you will maintain and design our Airscwo systems. This will include providing support during the initial testing of systems, testing various operating conditions, performing planned and unplanned maintenance and system checks. The role will require a combination of office work and fieldwork, as well as significant travel and time on-site.  

WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Process Engineer, you will perform a large number of tasks related to designing, maintaining, and optimizing the process in our AirSCWO system in preparation and deployment. Some of the specific tasks of the Process Engineer include:* Designs, implements, controls and optimizes industrial processes
* Assesses existing processes and workflows
* Optimizes productivity by designing, implementing and testing new procedures
* Develops best practices and solutions to improve production rates and output

  

WHO YOU ARE
Qualifications, Experience and Skills* 2+ years’ experience performing Process Engineer duties of designing in an industrial environment
* Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical, Manufacturing, Mechanical, or similar or experience in lieu of education
* Experience in wastewater, water, and waste treatment processes, operations, and equipment for municipal and industrial applications preferred, but not required
* Experience with boilers and chemicals a plus
* Knowledge and experience in high-pressure, supercritical, hydrothermal, or similar processes preferred, but not required
* Specific relevant area of expertise in pressure systems, electrical & instrumentation, metallurgy, separations, valves, pumps, etc.
* Willingness and ability to travel to company, client, partner, and event locations, and spend contiguous weeks on-site with clients
* Outstanding social, communication, and interpersonal skills
* Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills

  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS* This position requires using hands to troubleshoot equipment, close vision, and dexterity with fingers
* This position requires an individual to sit for long periods of time, stand, and move about the facility
* Ability to lift 40 lbs

  

WHAT WE OFFER* Worldwide impact with a clear vision, mission, and values-driven culture
* Company with a cutting-edge technology that is making an impact on the environment, people, and world
* A fast-paced company where you can make an impact and positive change for safer and healthier water
* Working with a talented team and bright minds
* Competitive compensation and benefits package including stock options
* Opportunities for growth & learning

  

374Water is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.
www.374water.com

title: Junior Process Engineer for manufacturing OT (hybrid/remote)
description:
24138
Young Professionals
Industrial IT
Vacaville  


Become part of the SpiraTec success story and actively contribute to the establishment of our team at our Bay Area (Vacaville), California location. We are seeking a highly motivated Junior Process Engineer to join our team for Operational Technology (OT) in manufacturing. In this hybrid position, you will work with our local and international team to deliver top-quality projects to our customers in the Pharmaceutical Manufacturing environment. As a fast learner, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills and knowledge in the field of pharmaceutical IT/OT engineering.

**What are your responsibilities**
----------------------------------

* You will work on the implementation of contemporary technologies for digitalization and IT/OT and will be jointly responsible for compliance with quality standards
* Conduct system testing and debugging activities to ensure the successful implementation and qualification of IT/OT systems
* Work closely with our international team to ensure the successful delivery of projects
* Together with experienced colleagues, you will conduct workshops/training sessions and be responsible for system documentation
**What we appreciate about you**
--------------------------------

* You have an engineering degree in chemical, process, pharmaceutical or in computer sciences. We may also consider other areas of engineering
* You are a team player who enjoys working in a dynamic project environment to ensure successful delivery of customers project needs
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with an international team
* Willing to travel both national and international to support customers

* Career changers with transferable skills are welcome to apply

**What awaits you at SpiraTec**

* We support our employees individually through training and offer the opportunity to develop into a leadership role

title: Chemical Incident SME (WMD)
description:
Overview:Established in 2004, Culmen International is committed to enhancing international security, strengthening homeland defense, optimizing government operations and providing humanitarian assistance around the world. We provide technical and management expertise, develop innovative technology solutions, and deliver youth care services, logistics, training and language services worldwide. With experience in over 126 countries, Culmen supports our clients to accomplish critical missions in challenging environments.

Roles & Responsibilities:Culmen International LLC is seeking a Senior Subject Matter Expert (SME) to serve on a team supporting the Department of Homeland Security Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction (DHS CMWD) Office. The SME shall work with state and local organizations responsible for preparing, preventing, and responding to domestic chemical incidents, interfacing directly with emergency management officials and first responders at all levels within a community to build a community-wide approach to enhancing critical decision making prior to, during, and after a chemical accident or incident.

* Demonstrate a deep understanding of preparing communities for chemical incidents, emphasizing a bottom-up strategy rather than exclusively relying on top-down federal directives.
* Facilitate collaboration among various first responder agencies across the U.S., promoting effective communication and coordination and helping improve the efficiency and effectiveness of a chemical incident response.
* Work closely with communities to identify and catalog resources crucial for chemical incident preparedness, acknowledging that some information may not be available electronically, could be held by the private sector, or may not currently exist.
* Develop a system engineering approach with tools to help local response assets better understand their unique chemical risks and assess their current capabilities and greatest needs.

Basic Qualifications:

* U.S. citizenship.
* Master’s degree in chemical engineering, emergency management, or a related field. Additional years of experience will be considered in lieu of an advanced degree.
* 10+ years of experience working at the state and local level as a recognized chemical defense (prevention, preparedness, and response) subject matter expert.
* Experience in performing technical risk assessments to determine a jurisdiction’s capabilities and gaps to adequately respond to chemical threats, accidents, and incidents, and how to properly address those gaps.
* Experience supporting the development and execution of training and exercises at the local jurisdictional level that address capability gaps and provide lessons learned for continuous improvement.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Prior experience at the DHS CWMD Office

Top Tier Benefits Package:

At Culmen International we are committed to creating, promoting, and sustaining a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our commitment to these values is unwavering across all our work around the world. We include and celebrate employees of diverse races, genders, religions, sexual orientations, ethnicities, nationalities, socioeconomic statuses, languages, (dis)abilities, ages, and religious commitments. These differences drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our employees and clients. Culmen is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Principal Manufacturing Systems Engineer
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.


Principal Manufacturing Systems Engineer

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this dynamic role you will develop a matrixed team of engineers to implement strategic development of automation technologies for Amgen. The team will design, develop, and deliver innovative solutions enabling the advancement and intensification of Amgen processes.

**Responsibilities include:**
-----------------------------

* Manage and lead process automation support teams for MCS Drug Substance manufacturing in Thousand Oaks, CA.
* Network internally and externally to define problem statements and identify key technologies and potential solutions in the advanced automation and process control field.
* Plan and implement change efforts for automation strategy for the company, beginning in the Manufacturing and Clinical Supply (MCS) organization.
* Define the strategy for automation and process control within MCS Drug substance manufacturing. Partner with senior management within Process Development to secure resources for programs of critical importance.
* Lead the team implementing the development strategy. As part of the Facilities & Engineering (F&E) group within the Manufacturing Clinical Supply (MCS) organization, the Principal Manufacturing Systems Engineering will work with the Senior Manager Engineering Manufacturing Systems at Amgen.

**This role is expected to provide leadership as follows:**
-----------------------------------------------------------

* Serve as an experienced advisor to senior level management and ensure the automation development strategy aligns with Amgen Process Development strategy.
* Partner with Process Development, Amgen IS, and commercial manufacturing teams to ensure compliant delivery of developed solutions.
* Strategic and tactical management and leadership in providing day to day operational support and capital project support, mentoring, staff development, team productivity, and efficient use of available resources.
* Develop support structures with internal/multi-functional teams for capital projects, plant support, and Amgen network-level initiatives execution.
* Providing input into department objectives and establishing strategic direction within the Drug Substance Network F&E automation team.
* Maintain and improve capabilities and automation systems reliability in partnership with F&E and plant leadership and other technical staff in the network, focusing on “predict and prevent” systems failures and recurrence avoidance. Strategize asset lifecycle management and long-range plans for equipment Maintenance.
* Work with diverse groups (Manufacturing, Quality, PD, Automation, IS, EHSS, Global Engineering) and drive new business processes to ensure continuous and sustained improvements. Translate business needs into engineering technology solutions. Lead analysis of alternatives and recommendations for technical/business proposals.
* Identify areas of potential improvement, conduct analyses, recommend solutions, sponsor improvement projects, and implement.
* Ensure site readiness and compliance for internal audits, external agency audits, and partner audits. Ensure the safety of all personnel during plant operations and engineering activities.
* Ensure that all staff are adequately trained and follow all GMP standards and procedures.
* Ensure Business Continuity, identify gaps and develop/implement solutions to close the gaps.
* Develop and adhere to department budgets and spend for operational and capital expenses.
* Be knowledgeable about compliance and regulatory aspects for operation and maintenance, equipment validation, and support regulatory inspections and audits.

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Engineering professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Doctorate degree and 2 years of Engineering experience

**Or**
------


Master’s degree and 6 years of Engineering experience

**Or**
------


Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of Engineering experience

**Or**
------


Associate’s degree and 10 years of Engineering experience

**Or**
------


High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Engineering experience.

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Masters and/or Ph. D. in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
* 10-15 years experience working in the process automation field within the biopharmaceutical industry.
* Ability to work independently and in small or large groups.
* Demonstrated proficiency in implementation of advanced process control applications in an industrial setting (e.g. Model Predictive Control, Adaptive Control).
* 5-10 years experience as an engineer or system administrator within the DeltaV Distributed Control System, Rockwell, ABB Robot, Mitsubishi Roller Bottle machine, Plant utilities, cleaning system and Building management system.
* Greater than 4 years proven experience leading matrixed teams.

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Senior Energy Engineer – NORESCO (Remote)
description:
**Country:**

United States of America**Location:**

CAGAO: Carrier-Home Georgia Remote Location, Remote City, GA, 30303 USA**We're improving the environment & creating a sustainable future. What will be your legacy?**


Whether you are looking to launch your green-collar career or accelerate it, NORESCO can offer you the challenge you are looking for. Part of Carrier Global Corporation, we’re one of the largest energy services companies in the U.S supporting the creation of energy- and water-efficient, sustainable, and high-performance environments for our customers.


From school districts to historic national landmarks, every day, NORESCO employees are improving the environment and helping to create a sustainable future. As the demand for modern energy infrastructure increases, the need for NORESCO’s services grows too. That’s where you come in. Join us to play an integral part in solving energy problems and make your future self proud.


What we offer

* Varied work in a diverse, supportive and collaborative environment
* Vast opportunities for professional development through our Learning Portal and Employee Tuition Program
* Extensive and flexible benefits program including:
	+ attractive medical, dental and vision plan
	+ retirement savings plan
	+ generous PTO policy
	+ wellness program

**About this role**


As a Senior Energy Engineer at NORESCO, you will lead the technical development of projects or specific energy conservation measures in support of large complex projects. You will collaborate and interact with customers as well as other NORESCO staff including Senior Project Engineers, Sales, Project Developers, Design Engineers, Construction Managers and Measurement and Verification (M&V). You will also be representing NORESCO at customer sites visits and conference calls as part of the engineering team. You must have a thorough and advanced understanding of technologies and technical solutions, development processes of ESPC and UESC contracts and federal customer expectations, requirements and standards. Must possess a strong technical background with excellent communication and technical writing skills.

 **Key Responsibilities**


Support the technical team during all phases of project development including overall responsibility in conducting energy audits, site investigations, ECM scope development, energy savings calculations, and developing cost estimates for large federal, commercial and institutional facilities. Work within the engineering team to improve processes and procedures.

* Conduct energy audits, site investigations, energy savings calculations and develop cost estimates to Identify and quantify energy conservation opportunities associated with a variety of technologies and solutions.
* Coordinate and schedule site visits with customers and NORESCO personnel.
* Complete energy calculations using whole-building modeling and temperature- bin analysis methods to calculate energy savings associated with ECM upgrades.
* Analyze utility bill data to determine customer energy performance parameters.
* Analyze customer operational costs to develop operational savings models associated with proposed technical solutions.
* Write detailed Energy Conservation Measure descriptions to be included in proposal submissions as well as scopes of work for subcontractors.
* Support improvement of processes and tools for development and analysis of technologies and offerings.
* Support technical discussions of scope, savings, and M&V methods during Customer and Senior Management review calls.
* Support the development of measurement and verification plans with M&V team.
* Mentor and support training of lower-level engineering staff.
* Work cross functionally with Sales, Project Developers, Design Engineers, Construction Managers, Operations and Maintenance (O&M) and Measurement and Verification (M&V) during the project lifecycle and support functional improvements.
* Travel up to 40%

**Required Qualifications**

* 5+ years’ experience working in the Energy or Sustainability Services industry
* Bachelors’ Degree

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or Architectural Engineering
* MBA, PE, and CEM are not required, but are considered a plus
* Experience using building energy modeling software
* Demonstrated collaboration skills and working within a team environment
* Proven track record developing technical solutions and projects
* Advanced technical abilities to understand and analyze a wide variety technical solutions
* Strong organizational, technical writing and verbal communication skills with a high level of attention to detail
* Proficiency in MS Office including Word, and Excel

title: Manager, Packaging Supply Chain Engineer
description:
**Manager, Packaging Supply Chain Engineer**


**Who we are:**



Agios is a biopharmaceutical company that is fueled by connections. We thrive in a supportive, fun, and flexible environment full of people empowered to bring their whole selves to work. We care deeply about our work, each other, and the patients who count on us. Our teams cultivate strong bonds with patient communities, healthcare professionals, partners and colleagues, which helps us discover, develop and deliver therapies for genetically defined diseases – and make a bigger difference in their lives. In the U.S., Agios markets a first-in-class pyruvate kinase (PK) activator for the treatment of hemolytic anemia in adults with PK deficiency. Building on the company’s leadership in the field of cellular metabolism, Agios is advancing a robust clinical pipeline of investigational medicines with active and planned programs in alpha- and beta-thalassemia, sickle cell disease, pediatric PK deficiency and MDS-associated anemia.



**The impact you will make:**



Agios Pharmaceuticals is searching for a dynamic **Manager, Packaging Supply Chain Engineer** to join our growing Supply Chain team. Agios outsources all cGMP packaging operations to third party CMOs. The selected individual will be responsible for technical aspects of commercial packaging and will have full exposure across early clinical to new commercial product launches. This role will primarily support packaging operations but will also have responsibilities in other aspects of Supply Chain Operations.

  


**What you will do:**


**Packaging Engineering**


* Will be responsible for technical ownership in commercial packaging operations at CMOs including packaging specifications, components, change controls, deviations. Support supplier operations to ensure production is executed on time and in full.
* Implement continuous improvements to existing commercial packaging processes.
* Support development and validation of the packaging processes for new products or new markets including North America, EU and Rest of World markets.
* Support of regulatory filings to support packaging process, components, and artwork.
* Align with serialization team on worldwide serialization requirements and ensure all aspects of packaging comply with market regulations.
* Support commercial artwork changes for existing commercial products and collaborate with artwork team to develop new artwork for new product or market launches
* Contribute as technical owner in cross functional team consisting of Regulatory, Commercial Marketing, CMC and Quality to design new market packages.
* Provide technical support to CMC and Clinical Supply Chain to evaluate early phase clinical packaging and advise on any clinical packaging production technical issues.
* Provide support and oversight for all packaging components upstream in the supply chain, including API, Drug Product and Key Materials.

  


**Operations Support**


* Support cross functional teams to execute cGMP activities for end-to-end Commercial Supply Chain Operations for DS, DP and packaging with CMO partners
* Collaborate with Supply Chain Planning and Technical Operation teams to ensure that CMO manufacturing performance aligns with commercial manufacturing plans, lead times, inventory policies, capacity constraints and risk mitigation strategies.
* Collaborate with Finance and Cost accounting team to ensure proper inventory accounting financial reporting. Provide data entry, and data analysis of production activities throughout the supply chain utilizing ERP system.

  


**What you bring:**


* Degree in Packaging or Chemical Engineering discipline.
* 5+ year of pharmaceutical packaging engineering experience.
* Proficient in MS Office and MS Project.
* Ability to Travel 25% for production or supplier oversight.
* Must be detail focused with an ability to influence suppliers and projects with minimal oversight yet work collaboratively in a team environment.

  


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Degree in Packaging engineering
* Experience with new product launches
* Experience with ex-US product supply and regulatory requirements including EU and Asia Pacific Markets


**Work Location:**


**Location Agnostic:** Work location for this role is based on employee's individual preference. This role has the ability to be either remote in the US or hybrid in our Cambridge Headquarters. Hybrid schedules vary but are generally less than 3 days per week onsite and hybrid employees are expected to live within commutable distance to our Cambridge Headquarters. Remote employees work entirely from home except for attending Company sponsored events/ meetings. For employees who choose to work remotely, travel may be required for certain company events commensurate to the above job description.

  


**What we will give you:**


* ***Deliberate Development****.* Your professional growth as one of our top priorities.
* ***Flexibility.*** We’re all about individual needs. We embrace different perspectives, work styles, health and wellness approaches, care of families and productivity. When you’re at your best, we’re at our best.
* ***Premium benefits package****.* We invest in the health, wellbeing and security of our people with a premium benefits package that is well-rounded and flexible to help meet the varied personal and professional needs of every member of our team.
* ***Competitive performance-based compensation.*** This includes both short- and long-term incentives that are connected to our business strategy.
* ***Psychological safety.*** We support an environment of fearlessness. We want you to share your ideas, speak candidly and take data-informed risks to help push the boundaries.
* ***Commitment to diversity.*** We strive to foster a welcoming workplace where everyone can thrive. We’re continuously looking to improve the inclusivity of our workforce.
* ***Commitment to community.*** We’re an active participant in the communities that surround us – the communities where we live, and the community of people and their loved ones in need of better treatment options for conditions that are often overlooked.

  


***Interested in learning more about what makes our culture unique? Visit the*** ***Inside Agios*** ***section of our website.***

title: Senior Energy Engineer
description:
About Cadeo

Cadeo works at the intersection of policy, markets, and technology. We support utilities, public agencies, and private industry in their efforts to advance energy efficiency and clean energy resources for a cleaner, more sustainable future. To this end, we characterize markets, analyze distribution channels, assess emerging technologies, and analyze policy impacts. Through these services, we provide our clients with actionable recommendations and the ongoing guidance to implement them. Our approach is simple: we listen first, ask next, and answer last.

Our Culture

Each of us helps shape the culture we want. Our work is our craft—something we want to get better at every day. So, we take it seriously. To us, that doesn’t mean formality; it means a commitment to continual development, both individually and collectively. It means having the desire to know what works better and the humility to recognize something probably does.

As we continue to grow, our culture will no doubt evolve, but the following core principles will not:  
We start with the premise that we don’t know. That way, we listen better.  
We value candor, curiosity, and clarity.  
We seek feedback. Really.  
We share knowledge. Relentlessly.  
We guard against the creep of bureaucracy.

Cadeo is seeking an experienced Senior Engineer to support energy efficiency research projects with utilities and government agencies. This is a full-time position perfect for experienced consultants or engineers with a solid track record of successfully completing projects on time and on budget. As well as having strong technical experience, the ideal candidate will have an established track record of meeting and exceeding client expectations.

We are looking for someone with experience in the energy efficiency consulting industry and/or industrial energy management who possesses exceptional analytical skills and a strong willingness to learn. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who performs at a high level (independently and as part of a team), has experience conducting research, collecting data in a laboratory/field environment, analyzing large sets of data, and has at least 7 years of experience in a related field (scientific research, engineering, industrial operations/energy management, data analysis). The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker, capable of distilling research findings into key takeaways and implied next steps.

We highly encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. The successful candidate will commit to an equitable and inclusive workplace, including but not limited to; racial equity, accessibility for individuals with disabilities, use of gender inclusive language and cultural sensitivity.

This is a full-time position located in Cadeo’s Portland or Seattle office. However, Cadeo is open to hybrid or fully remote-position on a situation-by-situation basis.  
**Your Qualifications**

* At least 7 years of experience in energy efficiency consulting, with at least 2 years of experience managing projects and client delivery.
* Excellent understanding of motor driven systems, including commercial and industrial pumps, fans, air compressors, & material handling/processing. Experience with motor and motor driven equipment metrics, energy code requirements, and system installation/operation. Familiarity with the theoretical and real-world applications of different motor technologies or efficiency options related to motor driven systems.
* Demonstrable experience with analytical problem solving (summary and synthesis of data) and documenting findings in memos, reports, and/or presentations.
* Fluent in MS Office applications, with extensive experience in Excel and Word.
* Strong mathematics and engineering background; mechanical engineering desired; chemical engineering, civil engineering, physics, statistics, applied math or other engineering disciplines also acceptable.
* Expert use of Microsoft Excel and/or more advanced data analysis tools, e.g., R, MATLAB, Python, SQL.
* Experience developing experimental designs and implementing quantitative data analysis approaches, including statistics and data quality management approaches.
* Experience with utility program design and implementation.
* Strong written and verbal communication capabilities.
* Strong team player with experience managing large diverse teams, including experience mentoring and overseeing the work of junior staff, stakeholder management, and direct client communication.

**Your Contributions**

* Working with market actors to understand barriers to implementing energy efficiency and decarbonization programs and implementing methods to overcome those barriers.
* Developing and implementing research strategies to meet client needs.
* Leading analysis tasks including day-to-day management of projects.
* Collecting and analyzing data, including identifying the best source for information and ensuring data accuracy and quality
* Synthesizing findings and results to provide actionable insights and recommendations for next steps.
* Overseeing report and quantitative model development.
* Presenting research findings in written reports and slide presentations using compelling narratives and graphics (please visit our website for examples).
* Leading and/or contributing to multiple project teams, including mentoring and overseeing the work of junior staff, handling questions and requests from clients and from project team, and escalating project issues appropriately to senior staff

The base annual salary for this full-time position is between $80,000 and $130,000 depending on skills, expertise, and experience. Cadeo also offers annual performance-based bonuses and a benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance; 401(k) with employer match; paid time off (including most federal holidays); company-funded disability and life insurance; and paid parental leave. Cadeo does not cover relocation costs. This position is open to applicants based in the US.  
This posting will close on February 29, 2024.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Please **DO NOT** contact our consultants or team members directly regarding the position.  
If there are multiple locations associated with a title, please apply for your preferred location and indicate your interest or willingness in any other locations in your cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

title: Relief Systems Engineer 2
description:
**POSITION DESCRIPTION**

 **TITLE:**

  

Relief Systems Engineer 2

 **DEPARTMENT:**

  

Relief

  

Systems/Process

 **REPORTS TO:**

 **FLSA:**

  

Engineering

  

Relief Systems Program Manager

  

Exempt

 **WORK SCHEDULE:**

  

M-F 8:00AM-5:00PM

 **TRAVEL REQUIRED:**

  

Up to 20%

 **LOCATION:**

  

Remote

 **MANAGEMENT:**

  

No

 **EEO:**

  

Professionals

 **JOB FAMILY:**

  

Professionals

 **A Little About Us:** ZAP is a full-service engineering, design, and construction management firm servicing the oil & gas, heavy industrial, mining, and manufacturing sectors. From our Lakewood, Colorado office, we execute projects across North America spanning from California to Florida and Canada down to Mexico. Our projects range in size from simple engineering studies or maintenance repairs to full-scale design of large facilities. ZAP operates at a fast pace while providing a team-centric approach to our work.

 **About your role:**


This is a professional position for a Relief Systems Engineer working for an engineering consulting firm in the oil and gas, mining, and heavy industrial industries.

 **Essential Duties and Major Responsibilities**:

* Conduct relief device sizing calculations
* Conduct flare and relief header hydraulic modeling (Aspen Flare System Analyzer, VMG Flare)
* Generate process simulation for emergency relieving conditions (HYSYS, Promax, VMG, UniSim)
* Participate in site visits for data gathering
* Update Process Flow Diagram (PFD) for protected systems
* Update Piping & Instrumentation Diagram (P&ID) for protected systems
* Conduct peer checks and reviews

 **Work Hours:**

 **Company Hours**

  

This position works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Hours vary and are dependent on business needs.

 **40-Hour Work Week**

  

Monday through Friday, Hours may vary with the workload.

 **Evenings/Weekends/OT**

  

As needed to satisfy the requirements of the position.

 **Benefits:**

* Medical Insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision Insurance
* 401(k)
* Accrued PTO
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Basic Life / AD&D
* Voluntary Life / AD&D

**Education**

* Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering
* 3 years’ experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education

 **Type of Experience Needed to be Successful**

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Outlook, Excel
