* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Working knowledge with relevant industry codes and standards such as API 520/521
* Experience with Curtiss Wright iPRSM, Smith & Burgess Salus, ioMosaic SuperChems and/or Siemens PSPPM preferred.

 **Specialized Skills**

* Intermediate communication (written and verbal) skills, to deliver more complex information effectively.
* Intermediate problem-solving skills to be able to manage complex tasks and work through to solution with little guidance and direction.
* Advanced leadership skills with experience leading large or technical teams through complex deliverables.
* Proficient user of technology and software required to execute daily tasks.
* Advanced mathematical, organizational, and time-management skills.

 **Supervisory Expectations:**

* The position does not have any regular responsibility for overseeing or supervising the work of other team members.

 **Independence of Action**

* Results are defined and existing practices are used as guidelines to determine specific work methods and carry out work activities independently; supervisor/manager is available to resolve problems.

 **Physical Demands and Work Environment:** (The phrases "occasionally," "regularly," and "frequently" correspond to the following definitions: "occasionally" means up to 1/3 of working time, "regularly" means between 1/3 and 2/3 of working time, and "frequently" means 2/3 and more of working time.)

* The work environment is the typical office, and construction environment. The employee must complete their work satisfactorily in an environment where there are significant distractions, including staff, clients, and vendors walking through and conversing, telephones ringing, conversations carrying over, loud noises, and interruptions to answer questions from others. As well as loud noises, OSHA hazards, industrial materials, machinery & equipment, dangers chemical substances, and interruptions requiring the employee to answer questions from others. Must be able to drive to sites or meetings with clients.
* The physical demands described here represent those that an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. In many cases, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
* The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and should do so in a sound and safe manner. This job's specific vision abilities include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

 **Core Competencies**:

* Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed. Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting.
* Communications - Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; exhibits good listening and comprehension; keeps others adequately informed; selects and uses appropriate communication methods.
* Ethics - Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works with integrity and principles; upholds organizational values.
* Initiative - Volunteers readily; undertakes self-development activities; seeks increased responsibilities; takes independent actions and calculated risks; looks for and takes advantage of opportunities; asks for and offers help when needed.
* Job Knowledge - Competent in required job skills and knowledge; exhibits ability to learn and apply new skills; keeps abreast of current developments; requires minimal supervision; displays understanding of how job relates to others; uses resources effectively.
* Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; changes approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

title: Senior Engineer in the Source & Mask Optimization
description:
Location


San Jose, US


Team


Design Engineering and Architecture


Work experience


0-1 year


Educational background


Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Other technical backgrounds


Technical field


Software


Travel


No


Workplace type


On-Site


Fulltime/parttime


Full time


  
**Job ID:** J-00291554
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------

ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.


As a Senior Engineer in the Source & Mask Optimization group, you will enable the continuing shrink of semiconductor devices through resolution enhancement, match the imaging performance across a fleet of scanners, and assist in future scanner design.


*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

* Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.

----------------------------

Ph.D. or M.S. in Physics, Physical Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related areas.


Experience


* Knowledge of Optics, Semiconductor Lithography, and IC design.
* Experience in scientific simulation, numerical methods, image processing, optimization, computational geometry, machine learning, data sciences is a good plus.
* 3+ year experience in C++, Python, or other object-oriented software development.
* Solid understanding in data structures and algorithms.
* Experience in developing and debugging multi-threaded/parallel applications.
* Familiar with UNIX environment and scripting languages.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.

title: Process Engineering Advisor
description:
Who are we?
  
  

At Calumet we deliver innovative specialty products trusted by companies across the globe. We are the foundation to everyday essential products that help millions of people live and thrive. We are headquartered in Indianapolis and have numerous production locations in the US. We are customer focused and utilize our values of collaboration and entrepreneurship to grow the business. We offer a dynamic, high-performance environment where team members can have real input and impact on our business. If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves, treat the business as if it is your own and add value accordingly, come see why we’re Calumet Proud!
  
  

**PURPOSE:**  

This position provides process engineering support, mentorship, and guidance to Calumet operations facilities to achieve best in class process performance. Collaborates with internal and external sources to employ best practices, tools, and systems to continually improve catalyst systems management, process yield, energy efficiency, process monitoring, process economics, process safety, troubleshooting, and process reliability. Provides leadership in development and assessment of new process technologies and major process asset modifications.
  
  

**KEY OBJECTIVES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Develop with internal and external resources management systems to monitor and track process unit performance. This includes yields, energy efficiency, key process equipment performance, product quality, corrosion rates on key equipment.
* Manage overall catalyst system for all sites, including activity monitoring, optimization, and future strategy. This applies to both traditional fixed-bed catalyst as well as for renewable diesel and sustainable aviation fuel catalysts.
* Assist sites with troubleshooting, including finding qualified external and internal SMEs to get resolution of problems.
* Coordinate process support alliances and contractors with the sites. Examples:
* Process engineering support contractor alliances (Becht)
* Process chemical programs, cooling water programs, and wastewater treating programs and support (example: Baker Hughes)
* Process simulation software (example: KBC Petrosim)
* Facilitate best practice process networks as assigned.
* Review new process technology for application in sites.
* Review major process modifications and significant process equipment modifications as requested by site leadership or Operations SVP.
* Provide support when requested by Process Safety Management (PSM) group to support process safety.
* Conduct periodic performance review with Site Technical Staffs of key process units KPI’s.
* Develop process training on major processes in coordination with Site Technical leadership.
* Participate in incident investigations as requested by HSE group or Site Manager.
* Provide process technical as requested by other Ops Ex functions.


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCES:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering
* Minimum 8+ years of operating and technical experience in refining, lubricants, and/or chemicals manufacturing
* Technical expertise in fixed-bed hydroprocessing catalyst, distillation, and hydrogen generation.
* An advanced degree in Engineering or an MBA.
* Five years or more experience in a supervisory role.


**COMPETENCIES:**  

* Strong oral and written communications skills.
* Capability to positively communicate and interact with all levels of management and all plant levels.
* Strong leadership skills with ability to influence key contributors and others in improving process performance.
* Able to foster a team atmosphere when a team member.
* Skilled team leader who builds consensus.
* Able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Has ability to prioritize.
* Good overall process technical knowledge.
* Good judgement and decision-making skills.
* Demonstration of Calumet Values – Safety, Environment & Social Responsibility, Teamwork, Ownership, Passion for Customers, and Excellence


Salary and benefits commensurate with experience. We are an equal opportunity employer including disability and veteran. All offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.

title: Food Engineer
description:
Ollie was born with the mission of improving the lives of pets and pet parents nationwide. We make human-grade pet food, tailored for each dog’s nutritional needs, and deliver directly to our customers’ doors. Through Ollie’s carefully crafted meals and health services for members, dogs can truly live their healthiest, happiest lives.  

As a member of our growing team, you’ll take part in a company culture that cares deeply about its work and its team members.  

As an Ollie Food Engineer, you’ll be part of a small-knit pack of food, nutrition, and dog health experts that bring our food to life. In ways of working, you’re agile and flexible, willing to take the lead, be a team player, or follow the pack as the situation dictates. You’re passionate when it comes to performance and quality and you know that the team succeeds when you all work together towards the common goal - delighting and caring for our 4-legged best friends. You’ll show technical expertise and thought leadership through every stage of development - from concept, through trial and testing, and finally to the homes (and bowls) of some very lucky pups.  

  

**This role is based remotely in the US** and will report directly to the Head of Food.
### **Responsibilities:**

+ Design & develop new pet product concepts for dogs using scientific principles, consumer empathy, and a pet centric approach.
+ Coordinate with cross functional partners in Marketing, Strategy, and Operations to achieve shared goals and objectives for new product launches and existing product maintenance.
+ Assess opportunities to improve quality, costs, and/or competitive positioning of all new and existing products on a regular basis.
+ Coordinate testing for nutrition, sensory, shelf-life stability, and all other key technical attributes of new and existing products through the supply chain.
+ Develop specifications for finished goods, including requirements for raw materials, manufacturing processes, and key quality attributes.
+ Collaborate with internal and external partners to set standards and expectations for process, quality, and testing protocols.
+ Lead or support efforts to solve complex technical problems involving food ingredients, manufacturing processes, and/or quality parameters.
+ Serve as a passionate champion of Quality and Product Performance to delight pets, customers, and promote the Ollie brand

### **Preferred Experience:**

+ 4+ years in a Food Engineering/Product Development role, with a consistent track record of project leadership, cross functional collaboration, and delivery of successful products
+ Demonstrated knowledge and experience in new Product Development, with in-depth knowledge of ingredient functionality, process and packaging interactions, and key quality attributes
+ Demonstrated curiosity, empathy, and passion for creating insight & data-driven products that meet the needs of pups and their parents
+ Demonstrated strengths in solving complex problems, written and verbal communication, and translating technical data to any audience
+ Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Animal Science, Chemistry, Engineering or related technical field; higher degrees desirable
+ **Preference will be given to candidates with experience in pet nutrition and baking; other experience in relevant human or animal food designs and processes (meat science, RTE foods, complex formulations) will be considered**
+ Perseverance to succeed, willingness to tackle new challenges, and desire to learn and grow

### **Benefits:**

+ Competitive salary and a stake in the company
+ Sponsored 401k program with employer match up to 4%
+ Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental and vision
+ Unlimited vacation policy that you're encouraged to use
+ Paid parental leave
+ 1-week paw-ternity leave for new dog parents
+ Free Ollie subscription
+ Inspiring pack members!

*If you'd like to stand out, tell us in your cover letter why you're interested in joining Ollie and how your skills match the responsibilities detailed in this posting.*  

*Ollie embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We're committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Ollie is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please include that in your application.*

title: Extrusion Technical Service Engineer
description:
The Technical Service Engineer will be the technical lead working directly with customers in the processing of GEON’s products with concentration in molding or extrusion. The Technical Service Engineer’s primary responsibilities are process optimization and troubleshooting of GEON products at customer facilities, resolution of customer complaints, and acting as the technical interface between the customer, GEON’s manufacturing teams, and the R&D technical team. The Technical Service Engineer will leverage rich, hands-on experience in molding or extrusion to grow current business and build trusting relationships with customers in order to be the supplier of choice in future applications.
**Primary Responsibilities**


* Prepare and present safety, quality, and performance to customers and GEON leadership.


* Plan and execute trial runs.


* Determine and report on financial impact of projects.


* Document and prepare product specifications for manufacturing GEON products.


* Utilize proven project management methods to plan, lead, and assist with a full range of project sizes and scopes.


* Identify and implement improvements and/or best practices to reduce variation in our products and improve processing at customers (driving more value with customers).


* Collaborate with the Process Engineering GEON community on best practices and effective process improvements.


* Mine and analyze data to identify potential opportunities for manufacturing / process improvements.


* Perform effective root cause analyses.


* Coordinate with R&D partners to e quality and testing conditions for established GEON products.


* Monitor and revise processes to help generate cost savings and improve quality and efficiency of products and processes.


* Collaborate with Client-Facing / commercial team to enhance entanglement of GEON with customers at technological / manufacturing level.


* Participate in Customer visits and coordinate with assigned Account Manager to provide technical support and showcase GEON’s manufacturing and process capabilities.


* Evaluate, assess, and benchmark customers manufacturing processes and make improvement recommendations that translate into additional financial benefits to our customers.


* Offer working knowledge to assist with design for manufacturability, tool design support, FEA, Moldflow, and process simulation.


**Experience & Education**


* Bachelor's degree in Engineering is required, a focus on Plastics or Chemical Engineering is preferred.


* Minimum 5+ years of Process Improvement/Engineering experience in the Plastics industry with Extrusion and/or Injection Molding experience.


* Functional familiarity with processing a diverse polymer set (i.e. Rigid PVC, Flexible PVC, ABS, PP, and other engineered resins).


* Proficiency in process optimization, troubleshooting, and continuous improvement methodologies, with Six Sigma, Kaizen, and/or LEAN certifications/belts preferred.


* Extensive experience in plastic processing, including injection molding, extrusion, or blow molding.


* Strong knowledge of plastic materials, processing parameters, and equipment.


* Familiarity with quality management systems and standards, such as ISO 9001 and IATF 16949.


* This position may be required to travel up to 50% of the time

title: Technical Service Engineer - Plastics/Polymers (Central US Region)
description:
**PURPOSE OF ROLE:**  

The Central Region Technical Service Engineer role is to assist customers (OEM’s, plastic processors, and captive molders) & the CPA Central Region Commercial Team with plastic resin selection, processing, and datasheet management. The Central Region includes Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, western Kentucky, and all of Canada.
  
  

Candidate should live within the Central Region geography.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**  

* Work closely in a team environment with the CPA Central Region Commercial Organization with resin selection, performance data, and processing.
* Provide technical assistance to targeted customers with material selection, product development, and processing.
* Approach the sales & development process with a high degree of professionalism and effectiveness by successful utilization of customer centric selling skills.
* Work with the Application Development Team on prospecting new customers and new markets.
* Be a positive influence on the entire CPA Commercial Organization
* Manage and execute all third-party testing for the Commercial Tech Team
* Create and maintain CRM data and sales statistics as required.
* Work with Technical and Customer Service team to ensure customer requirements and satisfaction is met.
* Proven ability to interact effectively at all levels of the customer and with all the customers functional groups.


KNOWLEDGE / QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS / EXPERIENCE
  
* Complex thinking skills in translating customer needs into solutions.
* Technical aptitude and problem-solving skills
* Professional presence, including excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
* Broad knowledge of solutions, materials, and processing. Self-motivated and able to work autonomously on a day-to-day basis.
* Team player.
* Good interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong organizational skills required.
* Minimal training and oversight required.
* Strong computer skills, proficiency with PowerPoint MS Word & Excel and Outlook.
* Degree from an accredited college or university required: technical discipline preferred (plastic engineering, polymer engineering or chemical engineering).


Work Environment / Conditions
  
The work environment/conditions described herein are representative of those that an incumbent may experience, and therefore must be adaptable to.
  
1. Schedules may vary from week to week based on business demands in excess of 40 hours with or without notice.

The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an incumbent to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
  
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions & physical demands of this role.


1. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to communicate verbally, read, and comprehend information, type on a consistent and daily basis.
  
2. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to travel by foot, car, bus, airplane, or other means of transportation which require sitting, waiting and standing for long and short periods of time.

Ravago Americas is an equal employment opportunity employer. We adhere to a policy of making employment decisions without regard to race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, or marital status. title: Senior Engineer
description:
About Us:

Groundbreaker. Game changer. Pioneer.  

TRC has long set the bar for clients who require more than just engineering, combining science with the latest technology to devise innovative solutions that stand the test of time. From pipelines to power plants, roadways to reservoirs, schoolyards to security solutions, clients look to TRC for breakthrough thinking backed by the innovative follow-through of an industry leader.  

TRC's professionals work with a broad range of commercial, industrial and government clients and the communities they serve. We deliver breakthrough solutions that address local needs - so our clients can better succeed in an ever-changing world.  

Working at TRC means tackling interesting, meaningful projects. We pride ourselves on our collaborative spirit, entrepreneurial zeal and agile corporate structure. We recognize that the expertise of our staff is our strongest asset, so we generously reward employees for successful performance and invest in their careers through training and the development of new skills and certifications.
Overview:

TRC is seeking a highly motivated **Senior** **Environmental Engineer** to join our growing Engineering, Construction and Remediation Practice. The successful candidate will be a highly motivated individual looking for career growth and will be part of a very skilled team that works closely with Project Managers and other technical leads providing technical support for site investigation, due diligence, groundwater monitoring, remediation, and regulatory compliance projects.  

You will apply your knowledge and develop new skills while working on challenging projects. By providing you with mentors, you will attain a well-rounded knowledge that will offer boundless opportunities for your professional development.
Responsibilities:
* Assist with site background information reviews, data assembly and evaluation, and preparation of investigation work plans and cost estimates.
* Analyze survey reports, maps, drawings, aerial photographs, geologic data and other data to assist project planning.
* Assist Project Managers to define project scope, determine work procedures/sequences, and develop schedules, budgets, and staffing requirements.
* Provide technical guidance to Project Managers and field staff during implementation of investigations ensuring work plans are followed and technical and quality requirements are met.
* Prepare and review Site Characterization Reports, Remedial Investigation Reports, and other technical documents related to site characterization and investigation activities ensuring technical adequacy, quality, and consistent delivery and presentation of information.
* Prepare and review Feasibility Studies, Remedial Alternatives Analysis Reports, and other documents related to the remedy selection process.
* Plan and oversee implementation of pre-design investigations to develop/supplement technical data needed for remedy design including pilot studies and bench-scale tests.
* Self-perform remedial design work (calculations, technical specification and drawing preparation, remedial equipment/component selection, testing, etc.). This includes preparation and review of engineering reports, limited site data summary documents, contract documents, standard specifications, supplemental specifications, design drawings, advertisement and notice to bidders, and cost estimates.
* Attend and participate in pre-bid meetings, prepare and review addenda to the specifications and drawings, prepare and review responses to technical questions from bidders, and perform technical evaluation of bids.
* Review contractor submissions during remedial construction and provide written evaluations.
* Review and respond to information requests during remedial construction.
* Attend and participate in project meetings.
* Prepare and review Final Engineering Reports, Construction Completion Reports, and Site Management Plans.
* Complete remedial system performance and effectiveness evaluations and provide recommendations and plans for system optimization, if needed. Oversee implementation system optimization recommendations and plans.
* Prepare, review, and certify Periodic Review Reports for sites with completed remedies and on-going operation, maintenance and monitoring.
* Serve as task lead for specific portions of larger assignments and mentor less-experienced engineering staff in the gathering, analysis and correlation of basic engineering data.
* Perform Quality Assurance/Quality Control reviews of deliverables related to projects and tasks managed, as well as projects and tasks managed by others, and be responsible for implementation of the firms' quality procedures at project and task levels.
* Apply knowledge of regulations, rules, guidelines, field practices and techniques, standard operating procedures, data reduction and evaluation techniques, etc. to work products.
* Explain and present observations and findings using general understanding of geology, hydrogeology, chemistry, physics, biology, and mathematics.
* Interact with colleagues, clients, regulators, public, vendors, and subcontractors and follow corporate standards.


Qualifications:
* Professional Engineer license.
* Bachelor's Degree in Environmental, Civil or Chemical Engineering. Master’s Degree a plus.
* Ten plus years of relevant experience in consulting, environmental investigation and remediation, and remedial design, including preparation of remedial design drawings and specifications for public bidding.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office. Experience with software such as AutoCAD, ArcGIS, Visual MODFLOW, AQTESOLV, etc. is a plus and should be noted.
* Excellent and demonstrable interpersonal, verbal and written communication, motivation, team building, employee involvement/mentoring, diplomacy, and delegating skills.
* Willingness and desire to continue to improve and advance technical competencies.
* Ability and willingness to work independently and/or as a member of a team, including the ability to work on multiple assignments.
* Strong time-management skills with ability to meet tight deadlines and budgets.
* OSHA 40-hour training and up-to-date 8-hour refresher; or ability to obtain.
* Must possess a valid driver’s license, transportation and be able to pass a pre-employment motor vehicle records check.
* Ability to drive, travel and perform work away from home, office, and in outdoor environments for short-term tasks.
* Successfully pass a drug test prior to employment or within five working days from date of hire.

  

TRC offers advancement potential and a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with a company match. For more information please visit our website at www.trccompanies.com.  

In accordance with local law, the following compensation range is applicable for the job and location associated with this requisition: $100,000-$125,000. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, and other compensable factors.


Benefits: TRC offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

* Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
* 7 Paid holidays, 1 Floating holiday, and 15/20 Days PTO
* 401(k) plan and contributions
* Long-term/Short-term Disability

  

#LI-SE1


#LI-Hybrid


EEO Statement:

TRC is an equal opportunity employer: disability/veteran. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Salary Range: USD $100,000.00 - USD $125,000.00 /Yr. (Posted) Min: USD $100,000.00/Yr. (Posted) Max: USD $125,000.00/Yr.

title: Field Service Engineer - Chemistry
description:
MKS Instruments is a global provider of instruments, subsystems and process control solutions that measure, monitor, deliver, analyze, power and control critical parameters of advanced manufacturing processes to improve process performance and productivity for our customers. Additional information can be found at www.mks.com.
At Atotech, an MKS brand, we are looking for a Systems Engineer to support customers on the client site close to Charlestown, New Hampshire, and to cover the East Coast. You will service, install, demonstrate, and sell company chemistry products.
This role reports to the Business Manager, NA and partners closely with customers on their sites. While this role will be working out of your home office, you must be located close to a large customer in New Hampshire.
You Will:* Install chemistry products at customer facilities. Optimize the process and adjust as necessary.
* Analyze chemistry in a lab environment on customer site: ex. titrations, cross section analysis
* Train customer personnel.
* Perform inventories at customer sites. Write and submit chemical usage forecasts to Atotech planning.
* Perform audits of customer processes to insure optimum performance and continuous improvement.
* Coordinate with Atotech and customer shipping/receiving departments to resolve shipment and billing issues.
* Suggest improvements and refinements to existing equipment as well as new applications and opportunities.
* Perform analysis of customer process chemistries on site. (Via Atomic Absorption, ICP, Titration or other chemical analysis methods).
* Participate in demonstrations, technical presentations and any activity which could lead to increased sales of company products and services.
* Perform other related duties that may be assigned or associated with the responsibility of the position.


Required Skills;* Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineer or other technical/engineering field.
	+ Must have the ability to troubleshoot equipment problems


Preferred:* 1+ years of experience in the manufacturing industry troubleshooting of chemical processes.
* Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required for the position.
* Basic computing skills - proficient in MS Office, use the software tools for Chemical Analysis


Physical Conditions and Working Environments:* May work in a Cleanroom environment
* Wear personal protective equipment such as rubber gloves, face shield, safety glasses, respirators, hearing protection
* Standing, lift 50 pounds up to 4 feet off the ground.
* Noisy environment


All employees who handle hazardous waste will be trained initially within 6 months of assignment and annually thereafter. Training will be appropriate to the job position and may include (but not limited to) instruction on waste identification, determination, accumulation, inspections, labeling, manifesting, recordkeeping, and emergency response procedures.
#LI-DNI
Globally, our policy is to recruit individuals from wide and diverse backgrounds. However, certain positions require access to controlled goods and technologies subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Applicants for these positions may need to be “U.S. persons.” “U.S. persons” are generally defined as U.S. citizens, noncitizen nationals, lawful permanent residents (or, green card holders), individuals granted asylum, and individuals admitted as refugees.
MKS Instruments, Inc. and its affiliates and subsidiaries (“MKS”) is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer: diverse candidates are encouraged to apply. We win as a team and are committed to recruiting and hiring qualified applicants regardless of race, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), religion, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability or handicap, marital status, membership in the uniformed services, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other category protected by applicable law. Hiring decisions are based on merit, qualifications and business needs. We conduct background checks and drug screens, in accordance with applicable law and company policies.
MKS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process due to a disability, please contact us at: accommodationsatMKS@mksinst.com .
